name: Minesweeeper Dreams
description:
Classic minesweeper game with square, triangle, hexagon (hex) mines challenges.

Minesweeper Dreams is a logic / puzzle game.

Goal of the minesweeper game is to discover all tiles without a mine without detonating hidden mines. Number on discovered tiles says how many mines are around (all tiles adjacent to the one).

There is a minesweeper classic, which you probably know.
If you are advanced, you can challenge triangle mines where there are 12 neighboring tiles to consider for every step. This strains your brain and you have to really use logic to solve it.
You can play hexagon mine puzzles, shortly called hex too.

Minesweeper game progress is stored, so you can continue later where you left.

Game settings include:
 - Field shape - squares, triangles, hexagons (hex)
 - Preset field size - from Tiny to X-large
 - Level (number of mines).  - No Flags mode
 - Special modes - currently: Classic, Immortal (see explanation below)

User interface is options
 - type of click for discovering the field
 - vibration feedback
 - safety margin for close to border clicks etc.
 - wide open the filed on the first click
 - chording: fast open configuration (see explanation below)
 - color themes

Best scores of this minesweeper game are stored in your device.

If you sign-in and on-line, your score will be sent to service Google Play Games.
Not all game combinations have one. If the game you are playing has one, it is indicated by green dot next to Leaderboard in right bottom corner.

For enthusiast and pro players there is an information on board 3BV and after finishing 3BV/s and APM (actions per minute).

Immortal mode:
If you click on a mine, you will not explode. The tile is marked with an orange flag. For each such step, you will be penalized with penalty time. For the first case, it is 1 s. For each other, it is always double the previous penalty. This means successively 1, 2, 4, 8, 16 ... seconds.

Chording - Fast open configuration:
When you tap a tile with a number revealed and it has marked the same number of flags it will automatically discover all adjacent tiles to the clicked one. Of course, if there is a mistake in flagging, you will detonate. You can disable this or set it for a tap, double tap, long tap

Relax by playing minesweeper!

Easy to play, but hard to master.
